dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Moor b Jarvis 144 (140b 13x4 6x6) SR: 102.85

dismissalComment.html: carved away but he's hold out to sweeper cover. End of a magnificent knock. Looked a tired shot, because he was thrown off balance. They'll check for a no-ball it seems fine. All the Zimbabwe fielders walk up to shake hands with Imrul. He walks off to a standing ovation. What entertainment he's provided. First the rescue, then the thrill. Superb and he deserves all the applause that comes his way. More relief than elation in the Bangladesh camp.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Taylor b Mavuta 15 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: this is a short ball drifting in towards leg stump, Mushfiqur looks to pull, plays too early and in doing so has got some glove on this. Excellent grab down the leg side by the wicketkeeper, who may have been blinded just a touch. But his balance was superb as he made a swift move to complete the catch. Dharmasena's decision overturned and Bangladesh are wobbling.

headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: beauty of a delivery and he brings out the snake dance. Taylor is gone and this is a body blow for Zimbabwe. Lovely, lovely delivery. Got this to drift in from round the stumps, drew Taylor forward but he made the grave mistake of feeling for the delivery without covering the line. Played inside the line as a result and saw the ball deviate just a wee bit to beat the outside edge and crash into the stumps. As a left-arm spinner, you can't bowl a better delivery. Bangladesh are on top with that wicket. Superb from Nazmul, that would've made spin bowling coach Sunil Joshi mighty proud.

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza run out (Imrul Kayes/Mushfiqur Rahim) 21 (34b 1x4 0x6) SR: 61.76

dismissalComment.html: poor, poor running. Driven past the diving cover fielder. There was never a second, but they still decided to chance one. Excellent work from the wide long-off fielder who charged in and released the ball in a jiffy at the correct end. The throw to Mushfiqur wasn't all that accurate, but Mushfiqur did well to take it on the full and then lunge towards the stumps and break it airborne. Masakadza was miles short and Zimbabwe have lost a third. Outstanding glovework. Brain freeze from the batsman. Imrul having a dream day, he can do no wrong.

commentTextItems.html: slower bouncer, flat-batted to long-on. Game, set, match Bangladesh.

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.20pm A win looked unlikely for Bangladesh as they stumbled to 139 for 6 in 30 overs, but how they've bounced back. Imrul Kayes played the innings of his life to make 144, and with support from Saifuddin haled them past 270. Then with the ball, they were ruthless as you'd expect them to be at home. Mustafizur stifled them early, then the spinners took over and choked Zimbabwe before nailing the final blow. Victory was never in doubt 30 overs into the chase, with the visitors threatening a late charge at no stage despite dew allowing the ball to slide onto the bat a lot easier.

Not all is lost yet for Zimbabwe. This is a long series and they can look back on a few positives. Jarvis finished with four for 37 while Chatara took three wickets and Mavuta got one. Zimbabwe's bowling unraveled in the last 10 overs. What they would be really concerned with is their fielding.
Imrul Kayes is the Man of the Match for his 144.

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza run out (Imrul Kayes/Mushfiqur Rahim) 21 (34b 1x4 0x6) SR: 61.76

dismissalComment.html: poor, poor running. Driven past the diving cover fielder. There was never a second, but they still decided to chance one. Excellent work from the wide long-off fielder who charged in and released the ball in a jiffy at the correct end. The throw to Mushfiqur wasn't all that accurate, but Mushfiqur did well to take it on the full and then lunge towards the stumps and break it airborne. Masakadza was miles short and Zimbabwe have lost a third. Outstanding glovework. Brain freeze from the batsman. Imrul having a dream day, he can do no wrong.

headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor b Nazmul Islam 5 (13b 0x4 0x6) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: beauty of a delivery and he brings out the snake dance. Taylor is gone and this is a body blow for Zimbabwe. Lovely, lovely delivery. Got this to drift in from round the stumps, drew Taylor forward but he made the grave mistake of feeling for the delivery without covering the line. Played inside the line as a result and saw the ball deviate just a wee bit to beat the outside edge and crash into the stumps. As a left-arm spinner, you can't bowl a better delivery. Bangladesh are on top with that wicket. Superb from Nazmul, that would've made spin bowling coach Sunil Joshi mighty proud.

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear. What on earth was Tiripano doing? Dabs it into the off side, and sets off for a run even though he saw his partner put his hand out to say no. milestones.description: Imrul Kayes and Saifuddin's 127-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 7th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 101 between Naeem Islam and Mushfiqur

stories.title: 'Fine lines' cost Zimbabwe - Hamilton Masakadza
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Mirpur
